snippet: Circuits made with ink that can withstand the rigors of pressure, heat and moisture are replacing copper wire and bulky connections in new products.
abstract: Anne Eisenberg Novelties column observes that circuits made with ink that can withstand the rigors of pressure, heat and moisture are replacing copper wire and bulky connections in many new products; says one company, T-Ink, has developed inks so robust that circuits, sensors and switches can be printed on flat plastic and then molded into three-dimensional components.
lead_paragraph: Circuits made with ink that can withstand the rigors of pressure, heat and moisture are replacing copper wire and bulky connections in new products.

headline.seo: Electronic Ink Is Replacing Bulky Wiring in Products
headline.main: Hot Off the Presses, Conductive Ink
headline.print_headline: Hot Off the Presses, Conductive Ink
